Melissa is the reason this location should be considered if you are in Muscatine, Iowa! Be sure to check-in during shop hours so you can browse Creations by OZ and sample some great wines, infused olive oils and vinegars.
The apartment, located above the store with a street entrance, is a spacious studio with everything you need. The queen-size bed is tucked along the windows at the front of the apartment, with an ample closet complete with a chest of drawers tucked inside. Night stands flank the bed with a full length mirror in the corner. Desk with chair is along the wall with good lighting, chair and couch with two ottomans, side table, and flat screen TV round out the living room. Kitchen is fully equipped with island seating, coffee maker, refrigerator freezer, stovetop, oven, microwave, table service and pots and pans. Bathroom has a nice size vanity, mirror with good lighting and shower. Rooftop deck is off the kitchen with a view of the river. Special touches include fresh ground coffee, specialty soaps and shampoo. Melissa also provided face coverings, sanitizer and wipes (COVID-19).

review_text:
Staying here is one of the all too-rare times where one will find under-promises and over-delivery. The attention to the seemingly too-little details borders on the fanatical. It would seem thought was given to nearly every want in advance, then the needs filled before you ever realize you have them.
The room - and I hesitate to call it a room, as even suite pales - is huge. Truly, the pictures do not do the room justice, nor adequately convey the scale. Simply put, one more that receives value on square footage alone!
The crown jewel here, however, is the bed. This is where oh-so many “professional” hotel chains fall down and disappoint. Mere words nearly fail at describing the comfort. One can - and will ! - spend more money elsewhere, but not experience the rapture, the bliss, the peaceful slumber of a baby as one will here.
There are two minor quibbles that make the stay one very minor notch away from perfect, and those are the shower and the TV. The shower head is placed so that it is very difficult to escape the water, which results in the soap being whisked away as soon as applied. Perhaps a shower head with a length of hose would be better suited for this space. The TV is a bit small and underpowered on audio given the huge space, but the glaring flaw is the confusing manner in which one finds the channel one wishes to watch. For example, there is no guide or direction to simply tune to KWQC.
Again, these are very minor and one might not even care about such trifles. I certainly would not let them stop me from rebooking, and one certainly will do far worse than staying at St. Mary’s.

review_text:
I cannot speak highly enough for how wonderful staying at Bob and Paula’s AirBnb was. My group of 12 stayed for the weekend of a football game and all of us were in agreement that staying there was the highlight of the trip. Their hospitality is unmatched and they made us feel like family while staying with them.
They are in easy driving distance to major towns and cities in the area. Bob and Paula live in a separate section of the giant house allowing guests to have their privacy amongst the five bedrooms and giant living/entertainment/bar area. The house is incredibly clean, very cozy, and is accommodating to guests interests of all ages (bar area, ping pong table, pool table, outdoor pond, outdoor fire pit). They supplied all necessary linens, towels, soaps, and shampoos and had candy and bottled water in each room which made it feel like staying in a hotel. I offered to help gather our bed sheets and towels for cleaning but Paula took care of everything.
Every morning Paula made our group a breakfast served family style that we chose the night before. We were all impressed with her menu of over 12 items and so many additional options served including scones, yogurt, fresh fruit, and coffee all in addition to your selected entrée. I also have to reiterate that this huge delicious breakfast is included in what you already pay. They provide unmatched value for everything they give your group in addition to how nice it is staying there all for a super reasonable price!
My group had the most incredible time spent here and we cannot recommend them high enough!

Horse farm serenity
We're reviewing this property, and we'll send you a confirmation email if it's approved. In the meantime, you can post photos or
This was a beautiful property with 2 ponds and lots of rolling green hills. There is an option for horseback riding for an extra cost. The home that you rent is attached to the barn and you can go see the horses through the back door that leads directly into the stable. It is a fantastic place for dogs even when it's raining. The 2 bedrooms and bathroom are downstairs and the flooring is a finished concrete so you can breathe a sigh of relief worrying about accidents. One bedroom has a full bed and lots of space to put suitcases, cpaps etc. The second bedroom has a full bunkbed and another double so it fits six. There are fold out beds also. The bathroom is large and has shampoo and soap, hairdryer, and a washer and dryer with detergent and dryer sheets. They are pretty old and the washer takes forever to fill, the dryer takes a couple of runs to dry everything. Real towels for the shower. The shower has great water pressure, Ok temp, but is small made smaller by the two built in shelves. The upstairs is open concept with a good size dining table, kitchenette, full size fridge. They had eggs and bread for us to use. Then there are other odd and end chairs that fold and a large sectional. The TV is small and did not work the night we were there. They supply plates and utensils, microwave, small cooking appliances, odds and ends. You park right in front of the front door and can back up under the covered front to load and unload if raining. There is a hanging swing under this for watching the sunset. We saw Canada geese with babies, a pheasant, and their six horses. Just off hwy but you don't hear traffic.. It was my favorite place this vacation.

Even though it was only my husband and I this Airbnb would easily accommodate a larger family or for an extended stay.
We have traveled a lot and stayed at many Airbnb’s. This is my new favorite ,thank you for having us.
